patterns: What kinds of AI applications can be tested by this tool? Can I test NLP applications?
So I can’t test NLP applications. Is it right?
What functions are supported by the tool?
What kinds of tests can be done with this tool?

responses: Test cases can be generated for any type of application, but currently the application can have input type image only
We will add the feature in future
Input and context tree modeling,Test case modeling and Test case input modeling.
All kinds of AI application.
No

patterns: What is test case modeling?
What is the difference between test case input modeling and input tree modeling?
Can functional and performance tests both be done?
Is there template available for reference?
responses: Generating Test Cases based on provided input and the context trees. With this feature, users can generate test cases for all the combination for the respective input and context trees.

In Input tree modeling we are defining the factors which need to be considered while testing a certain product.  We use this tree while defining the test case group and to generate the test cases Test Case Input modeling refers to Data/Input Data required for the test case. In this module, we are providing the user ability to add input data to the test case either manually or with the help of a web search engine
No. Only functional tests can be done.
Not really
We plan to do that later

responses: No. This feature will need to be developed.

Yes, I agree

Can user use same login with currently with multiple browser?
responses: Currently the app is in the development stage. So the performance capabilities are limited and not supported.
Yes. We plan to support it in later version.
Current the performance testing feature is not available
No.
No, one user can’t login with multiple browser.

responses: Sure, you can edit or delete nodes.
There is a ‘create 5 Nodes’ option to add five child nodes with default names. Then you can select the node to rename with appropriate values.

Absolutely! There are two ways: First move your mouse over the node, right click then select ‘create child node’ option. A popup window will open. There is a plus(+) symbol on the popup window. With this you can add as many nodes required, then click create to add nodes to the tree. The second way is move your mouse over the node, right click then select ‘create 5 nodes’ option to add five child nodes with default names. Then select the node to rename with appropriate values.

You can Go to Login → Get Started → DATA ADMINISTRATION WITH GRAPH Move the mouse over the node.Right click on it and select “Rename Node” option.A popup window will open.Change name and Click rename.
Sorry, we don’t have this option.

The tree should have only three levels. There is no limit on the number of nodes and child nodes. Higher the nodes more number of test cases will be generated.

Sure. Move mouse over the node. Right click on it and option to delete the node will be displayed.

patterns: Hello, I can’t find my testing cases? Can you help me?
Yes. Thank You
Do you know where I can find my input testing cases?
responses: Yes, you can go to Login-> Get Started -> TEST CASE GROUP, then select appropriate test case group, scroll to right till you see the action column. Hover over each action button to see the description, click ‘View Test Cases’. Then you will be redirected to input test cases. Did I solve your problem?
Yes for sure, could you please clarify 'previous information'?
Previous information are the previous stages, like input and contect stages.

patterns: How can I fix the previous information when I am at the output stage?
Can I edit the input and context without generating the output tree when I reach the output stage? Like can I edit the information without saving it?
Could you please provide clarification?
How do we improve the invalid output?
I understand that, but can you provide a little bit more explanation?
How is the output tree generated?
responses: Users can create an output tree or output tree can be generated automatically based on the input and context tree. Once the “test case group” is created, users can edit input,context and output trees.
No, you cannot.
Once the “test case group” is created, users can edit input,context and output trees. Basically, you can generate the test case group first and then edit the information.
expected output is generated from output tree and stored as tree (similar to the input and context tree).
The output tree can be auto generated or the user can manually create the tree. User can manipulate this output tree to model the expected output
The output tree can be auto generated.

patterns: Can I do that manually?
How to export the output? Can I download the report instead of going back and forth?
I think you guy should really develop such function.
How is each output stored? Are there options for us to select?
What format is the application stored as?
What type of version is the output?
Yes, it is like what does it stored as?
responses: Yes, You can.
Currently we do not have this functionality. We are developing a report to export all test cases along with the input, expected output and application output.
Thank you for  this suggestion!
Expected output is generated from output tree and stored as tree (similar to the input and context tree).
Application output is stored in the form of String. This output is generated by the application.
Could you please explain what do you mean by version?
Expected output is generated from output tree and stored as tree (similar to the input and context tree).

patterns: What if I accidentally return back to the previous stage, will output information be saved?
Like going back to the context page/input page.
What will happen if the 'generate test cases' action was triggered and I interrupted it?
Yes
What is the difference between expected output and application output?
Like at the end.
When is application output generated?
When is the expected output generated?
How is expected output tree used?
responses: What do you mean by previous stage?
Expected output is generated from the output tree once “generate test cases” action triggered. If this action is interrupted then test case generation will be terminated
During the output stage right?
Then the test case generation will be terminated.
During which stage?

Expected output is generated from the output tree. Application output is generated after the execution of test cases. Expected output tree will be used to compare actual application output to rate the quality
Application output is generated after the execution of test cases.
Expected output as the output for the final stage.
Expected output tree will be used to compare actual application output to rate the quality.

responses: Are you looking for recovery?
Our system doesn't provide recovery.

Unfortunately no. If user deleted input/context test case then user will need to retrigger the generate test case action.

Yes, you do need to do that.
You will need to create an output tree.
In the child node user can put all the possible output strings or output tree can be generated automatically based on the input and context tree.
In our system menu? Do you need navigations?

Auto file versioning is not available but if you. Name the files accordingly and then user can store multiple versions of the file. Also, copy tree function is available
For output generation?
No. Currently we do not have this facility.

Yes. You can generate different expected output tree for same input and context group.
For a given image or video, which features are considered context?

patterns: Where can I find the deleted test case?
Right.

responses: Deleted from the Test Case Group?
Delete action is hard delete. I.e., you cannot view the test case once deleted.

No, delete action is hard delete.

patterns: How can I customize my own context tree?
Great! Do you mean each node represents a context feature?
Is there any limit to the number of nodes that I can enter?
Here, you mean at each level. Is there an upper limit on the total levels of nodes?
Hi, I cannot add a child node to the 4th level of the context tree. How can I fix this?
Ok, got it! I will modify it.
responses: You can customize your context features by simply changing the labels of nodes, adding or deleting nodes in the context tree.
Yep! Each node in the context tree stands for a context feature you designed. Besides, just let you know, you can enter subnodes as subfeatures as well.
There is no limit to the number of nodes you can create at each level. You can add nodes as needed.
Yes, you are right! So far, our context tree only supports 3 levels. When designing the context tree, be careful to the level restriction.
Oh, sorry to inform you that our context tree only supports up to 3 levels of design. I am afraid you have to get rid of the 4th level or simplify your design to 3 levels.
You can modify it offline and then upload the modified file, or modify online in the workspace and save the updated version.

patterns: What’s the recommended number of input features for a context tree? Is there any limit?
Got it! Will too many nodes affect efficiency?
How can I organize the context features? Can you provide a template?
How many subfeatures can I add to a context feature?
How can I change the order between features?
responses: There is no limit to the number of nodes and child nodes, but tree should have only three levels.
Great question! The greater the number of nodes, the more test cases will be generated and the longer it will take. So if possible create a tree with necessary key values.
You can organize your context features into a tree structure level by level. A parent node presents a context feature, and a child node presents a subfeature of that context feature.
There is no limit to the number of subfeatures you can add. But be careful, our context tree design only supports up to 3 levels.
Go to  Login → Get Started → DATA ADMINISTRATION WITH GRAPH

patterns: I tried to rearrange the order of child nodes in my tree but failed. Can you help me figure it out?
Got it! Will too many nodes affect efficiency?

How can I change the order between features?

How can I delete or add a node?
responses: I am sorry. Users are not allowed to do that directly. Nodes and child Nodes are sorted based on name (A-Z) after each action (add, delete and rename).
Great question! The greater the number of nodes, the more test cases will be generated and the longer it will take. So if possible create a tree with necessary key values.
You can organize your context features into a tree structure level by level. A parent node presents a context feature, and a child node presents a subfeature of that context feature.
There is no limit to the number of subfeatures you can add. But be careful, our context tree design only supports up to 3 levels.
Go to  Login → Get Started → DATA ADMINISTRATION WITH GRAPH
You can add, delete or rename a node in the context tree.
Navigation : Login → Get Started → DATA ADMINISTRATION WITH GRAPH. Hover mouse on the target node, and right click. You'll see the corresponding options.

patterns: Does the order of nodes at each level matter?

responses: Navigation : Login → Get Started → DATA ADMINISTRATION WITH GRAPH. Hover mouse on the target node, and right click. You'll see the corresponding options.
The order of nodes at each level will be automatically sorted based on name (A-Z) after each action. The order doesn't affect test cases generation.
Actually, there is no restrictions. However, more nodes will take more time to generate test cases and modeling inputs.
Did you save it? You can only restore info from the saved tree.
I am sorry, the answer is YES.
Did you save it? You can only restore records from the saved tree. If you didn't, you'll lose all the info.
Go to  Login → Get Started → DATA ADMINISTRATION WITH GRAPH. Select tree/file from dropdown list.
Move the mouse over the node. Right click on it and select “Rename Node” option. A popup window will open.Change name and Click rename.

responses: There are three ways. 1. Click near the tree Area (If tree is not manipulated). Use mouse scroll to zoom-in and zoom-out the tree.
No, we don't have that option. We utilize systems file explorer. But once user opens the directory and selects a file, the same directory will open during the user session.
Not exactly. The same directory stays open only if you only use this app.
Go to  Login → Get Started → DATA ADMINISTRATION WITH GRAPH. Drag and rearrange nodes feature is available. You can modify the tree this way.
Exactly. The operation is the same.
Of course. Mouse hover on a node and right click. Choose the "Create Child Node" option. You can customize the nodes to be added in the popup window.
Sure.There is a plus(+) symbol on the popup window. With this you can add as many nodes required, then click create to add nodes to the tree.

Select tree/file from dropdown list. Tree will be displayed.
Sure. But don't forget to save your changes.
Could you elaborate a bit more on 'separate context trees' you mentioned ?
At this stage, our application does not support multiple context trees in a file. A file only contains a tree.
Sure. You can choose to upload files or create online.
JSON. You should build your context tree as a json file.

responses: Yes. After you save it, we can download the corresponding json file generated by the app.
Yes, that's one way. Another way is to modify the json file directly.
Actions, such as add, delete, rename and etc. You can find different actions in the option list.
Mouse hovers on a node and right click, then the option list will appear.

patterns: I have been waiting for the test cases to be generated for a long time. It takes like forever...
Over 100 nodes.
It took me a long time to generate all the test cases. Is there a problem with too many nodes in my context tree?
How can I delete a node?
While building the context tree, my web page was frozen. what should I do?
You mean if I refresh I will lose what I have built so far!?
responses: May I ask how many nodes in your context tree?
The more nodes, the more test cases will be generated. It will take a looooong time. So if possible delete some redundant nodes and just retain the key ones.
I think you created too many nodes in you context tree. You can delete some redundant nodes and just keep the important ones.
Mouse hovers on a node and right click. Then you will see the delete option.
Probably you could try to refresh the page and redraw your tree.
Sorry, if the network connection is lost, we will not be able to recover what you created. Try to save the file often.

patterns: There is little room for me to add nodes to the third level of the context tree.
Yes, I would like to zoom out a bit. How can I do that?
How many contents can I add to my context?
Yes, that's exactly what I mean. I want to know the limit to the number of nodes I can add to the tree.
Can I merge two context trees into a single one online?
Is there any other way to merge two context trees? I don't want to build the merged tree from scratch.
responses: Do you want to zoom in or zoom out the tree?
Mouse scroll to zoom-in and zoom-out the tree, or click and hold to move tree around.
Do you mean how many nodes you can add to your context tree? Am I right?
There is no limit to the number of nodes in the context tree, but you can only have one root.
I am afraid you can't do it online. Because in the online editing, we only allow to add one and only one root node.
You can merge the two tree files offline. And then upload the merged JSON file.

patterns: What's the maximum depth of the context tree?

responses: You can merge the two tree files offline. And then upload the merged JSON file.
The context tree should have up to 3 levels.
Sorry, now we don't have this function.
What do you mean by property?
Sorry, now we only support adding category names to each node.
In our application, each child node can have and only have one parent node.
There is no limit to the number of child nodes.
Sorry, we don't have such function.
